title: OPEN DISCUSSION MARCH 2025 | Richard Dawkins Foundation for Reason and Science
snippet: I happen to think that government service is an honorable profession, based partially on a 30 year career and even longer dealing with government workers while I was at a private law firm. Government employees work very hard every day to provide the services their agencies were designed for.

title: Richard Dawkins | Biography, Books, The God Delusion, The Selfish Gene, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: Much of Dawkins’s work has generated debate for asserting the supremacy of science over religion in explaining the world. He also asserts that laws of probability preclude the existence of an omnipotent creator. After earning his master’s and doctorate degrees in zoology in 1966 at the University of Oxford under famed ethologist Nikolaas Tinbergen (who was best known for his work with both instinctive and learned behaviour), Richard Dawkins assisted Tinbergen before becoming an assistant professor of zoology (1967–69) at the University of California, Berkeley.

title: Richard Dawkins - Wikipedia
snippet: Richard Dawkins (born 26 March 1941) is a British evolutionary biologist, zoologist, science communicator and author. He is an emeritus fellow of New College, Oxford. In 1995 he was named the first Simonyi Professor for the Public Understanding of Science, a position he held until 2008, and is on the advisory board of the University of Austin.

title: OPEN DISCUSSION AUGUST 2025 | Richard Dawkins Foundation for Reason and Science
snippet: I see that former Special Counsel Jack Smith is now under investigation for a violation of the Hatch Act which makes it illegal for federal employees to engage in public partisan political activity. I’m sure there is more to the Act, but in all the time I worked for the government, I simply didn’t engage in politics, so I never had occasion to consult the Hatch Act.
